solution_line_template: For {num_apples} apples, Mary will pay {num_apples}*{cost_apple}= <<{num_apples}*{cost_apple}={cost_apples}>>{cost_apples} dollars.
For {num_oranges} oranges, she will pay {num_oranges}*{cost_orange}= <<{num_oranges}*{cost_orange}={cost_oranges}>>{cost_oranges} dollars.
For {num_bananas} bananas, she will pay {num_bananas}*{cost_banana} = <<{num_bananas}*{cost_banana}={cost_bananas}>>{cost_bananas} dollars.
For {total_fruits} fruits, Mary gets a discount of {total_fruits}/{fruits_for_discount} = <<{total_fruits}/{fruits_for_discount}={total_discount}>>{total_discount} dollars.
In total, the bill is {cost_apples} + {cost_oranges} + {cost_bananas} = <<{cost_apples}+{cost_oranges}+{cost_bananas}={subtotal_bill}>>{subtotal_bill} dollars.
Subtracting the discount offered by the stores, Mary will pay {subtotal_bill} - {total_discount} = <<{subtotal_bill}-{total_discount}={final_payment}>>{final_payment} dollars.
